statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Rhode Island 58, Massachusetts 55
article.story: SOUTH KINGSTOWN, R.I. (AP) -- Dawan Robinson's 3-pointer with three seconds to play lifted Rhode Island to a 58-55 win over Massachusetts on Wednesday night. The Minutemen's Chris Lowe missed a 25-foot desperation 3-pointer at the buzzer. Robinson finished with 14 points for Rhode Island (11-6 overall, 5-1 Atlantic 10) which won its fifth consecutive game. Massachusetts (9-7, 4-2) trailed 53-45 with 1:13 to play but tied the game 55-55 on Rashaun Freeman's layup with 10.6 seconds to play. Robinson brought the ball up the court and hit an open 3-pointer from the right. Freeman led UMass with 14 points and 10 rebounds. Will Daniels and Parfait Bitee each had 11 for Rhode Island and Jimmy Baron scored 10. Jeff Viggiano also had 14 and James Life scored 13 for Massachusetts, including 11 in the final six minutes. Viggiano sparked Massachusetts with nine points in the first half, including a 3-pointer and a dunk on back-to-back possessions to start a 9-0 run that turned a 14-8 deficit into a 17-14 lead. Bitee scored the last four points of the first half to give the Rams a 28-22 lead at halftime.
